snippet: The case of a young boy’s doomed journey has landed as a political bombshell across the Middle East and Europe.
abstract: Photo of lifeless body of 3-year-old Aylan Kurdi, face down on a Turkish beach after smugglers' boat taking his family to Greece flipped in high waves, seems to have drawn searing public attention to human cost of escalating migrant crisis; photograph, rocketing across the globe on social media, has forced leaders and citizens of Western nations to confront consequences of collective failure to help migrants fleeing Middle East and Africa for safe European shores.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and KARAM SHOUMALI
byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali reported from Istanbul, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul; Ben Hubbard, Hwaida Saad and Maher Samaan from Beirut; and Ian Austen from Canada. Bernadette Murphy contributed research.
